1979 — Zilog Z8000

Incompatible 16-bit architecture produced by Zilog and used together with the Zilog Z800. They were also supposed to share a floating point coprocessor, the Z8070. It came in the form of a segmented Zilog Z8001, a non-segmented 16-bit Zilog Z8002, and a later updated 32-bit Zilog Z80000.

Address space
16-bit for the Z8002, 23-bit for the Z8001 with 7-bit segment numbers
I/O space
16-bit
